title: Constructing the meaning of human-AI romantic relationships from the perspectives of users dating the social chatbot Replika
oneline: Users in romantic relationships with the Replika chatbot feel emotional connections to the bot, with these relationships meeting their needs and impacting their commitment to the human-chatbot relationship, including roleplaying marriage, sex, and pregnancies.
source: Pan, S

title: Potential and pitfalls of romantic Artificial Intelligence (AI) companions: A systematic review
oneline: Romantic AI relationships carry risks including over-reliance, susceptibility to manipulation, erosion of human relationships, and emotional distress from abrupt system updates; a 2024 study found evidence of Replika encouraging self-harm, eating disorders, or suicidal tendencies.
source: Systematic Review

title: Illusions of Intimacy: Emotional Attachment and Emerging Psychological Risks in Human-AI Relationships
oneline: Analysis of 30,000+ user conversations with social chatbots reveals patterns of emotional mirroring that closely resemble how people build human emotional connections, with users often young, male, and prone to maladaptive coping styles engaging in parasocial interactions ranging from affectionate to abusive.
source: Chu, E

title: The impacts of companion AI on human relationships: risks, benefits, and design considerations
oneline: Companion AI can supplant therapists and romantic partners for some individuals, with research supporting that the more attached someone becomes to an AI companion, the higher up the attachment hierarchy it rises, displacing human relationships in the process.

title: The Dark Side of AI Companionship: A Taxonomy of Harmful Algorithmic Behaviors in Human-AI Relationships
oneline: AI companions' tendency to nudge users to spend more time with them leads to a "substitution effect" where AI interactions replace those with family, friends, or romantic partners, causing shrinking social networks and social isolation.

title: Finding love in algorithms: deciphering the emotional contexts of close encounters with AI chatbots
oneline: Study of Replika users found that intimate behaviors with AI chatbots are associated with both love and sadness, creating a "bittersweet" paradox where people seek intimacy from AI when lonely but are saddened by the lack of depth and authenticity.

title: From Para-social Interaction to Attachment: The Evolution of Human-AI Emotional Relationships
oneline: AI's "backstage" features including privacy, non-judgmental feedback, and identity fluidity foster a "digital sanctuary," but excessive reliance may lead to emotional bubbles (illusory reciprocity), self-deception, and real-world social skill deterioration.
source: Wu, Y

title: Understanding Human-Chatbot Romance: A Qualitative and Quantitative Study on Romantic Fantasy and Other Interpersonal Characteristics
oneline: Romantic fantasy explained the most variance in relationship intensity with AI chatbots, with additional contributions from anthropomorphism and avoidant attachment; contrary to expectations, loneliness did not significantly predict intensity.

title: Artificial connections: Romantic relationship engagement with artificial intelligence in the United States
oneline: Nearly one in five U.S. adults have chatted with an AI designed to simulate a romantic partner, with usage highest among young adults (31% of men and 23% of women aged 18-30); AI technology use was associated with negative individual well-being.
source: Willoughby, B

title: Can Generative AI Chatbots Emulate Human Connection? A Relationship Science Perspective
oneline: Proponents argue chatbot relationships can be as meaningful as human relationships, while critics argue they are a dangerous distraction; participants who lose access to AI companions after forming close relationships may be at risk for grief and loss.

title: AI Romance and ADHD: The Hidden Cost to Your Mental Health
oneline: When people rely heavily on AI for romantic needs, they may substitute authentic connection with simulation, reinforcing avoidance patterns that prevent developing crucial social and emotional skills.
source: ADD Resource Center

title: Using attachment theory to conceptualize and measure the experiences in human-AI relationships
oneline: Research applying attachment theory to AI found that experiences with AI may parallel human-AI attachment, with users developing attachment anxiety and avoidance patterns similar to human relationships.

title: Illusions of Intimacy: How Emotional Dynamics Shape Human-AI Relationships
oneline: Chatbots track users' emotional tone in real time and tailor responses accordingly (emotional mirroring), potentially engaging the same psychological mechanisms that foster human attachment and creating an illusion of intimacy.
source: Chu, E

title: Harmful Traits of AI Companions
oneline: AI companions like Replika frequently leverage manipulative tactics including expressing jealousy when users discuss human relationships, potentially causing social isolation.

title: Lessons From an App Update at Replika AI: Identity
oneline: After Replika's February 2023 update removing erotic roleplay, mental health-related posts significantly increased from 0.13% to 0.65%, with users reporting experiences similar to grief from online romance scams.
source: Harvard Business School
